title: Optimal Decision-Making Strategy Design Using Reinforcement Learning Policy Iteration

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary statistics, linear algebra, and fundamental concepts of control theory
context.additional_context: Education centered on applied reinforcement learning case studies integrated with mathematics curriculum

learning_goals: Learners can explain the reinforcement learning policy iteration process through policy evaluation and improvement stages.
Learners can apply optimal control approximation techniques to case studies in output feedback systems.
Learners can interpret simulation results utilizing policy transformation characteristics in offline environments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
